remarks: Lemma for ~ axcont .  The idea here is to set up a mapping ` F ` that will allow us to transfer ~ dedekind to two sets of points.  Here, we set up ` F ` and show its domain and range.  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 17-Jun-2013.)
statement:
axcontlem2.1 $e |- D = { p e. ( EE ` N ) | ( U Btwn <. Z , p >. \/ p Btwn <. Z , U >. ) } $.
axcontlem2.2 $e |- F = { <. x , t >. | ( x e. D /\ ( t e. ( 0 [,) +oo ) /\ A. i e. ( 1 ... N ) ( x ` i ) = ( ( ( 1 - t ) x. ( Z ` i ) ) + ( t x. ( U ` i ) ) ) ) ) } $.
axcontlem2 $p |- ( ( ( N e. NN /\ Z e. ( EE ` N ) /\ U e. ( EE ` N ) ) /\ Z =/= U ) -> F : D -1-1-onto-> ( 0 [,) +oo ) ) $.
$d D t x $.
$d N i p t x $.
$d U i p t x $.
$d Z i p t x $.
